Communication Challenges: Without electricity, people may face challenges communicating with others who are located far away, as cell phone towers and internet connectivity may not be functioning properly.
Food Storage: Freezers and refrigerators rely on electricity to keep food fresh, so people living without electricity may struggle to store and preserve food for extended periods.
Hygiene Concerns: Basic hygiene practices such as washing hands, brushing teeth, and disinfecting surfaces may be challenging without electricity.
Comfort Issues: Without air conditioning or heating, people living without electricity may struggle to maintain a comfortable temperature inside their homes during extreme weather conditions.
Productivity Loss: Many people rely on electricity-powered devices such as computers and printers to complete work, so living without electricity may result in significant productivity loss.
